title.rendered: Ricky Ponting refuses to accept BCCI’s offer to coach Team India

content.rendered:
Australian cricketer Ricky Ponting has confirmed that the BCCI has given him an opportunity to replace Rahul Dravid as the coach of the Indian national team after the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 this year. However, Ponting said he was unlikely to apply for the post.

“I have seen many stories about this. Although such things often appear online before I know about them. There were some secret discussions during the IPL to find out my interest in being involved,” he told the ICC.

Ponting to get back to save India’s header, because that will force it to compromise with its agreement with Delhi capital flabise (DC). Which he is not willing to do. In addition, the Indian media’s media have enabled the head of the Australian head of the opportunity to accept the opportunity.
“Although I would love the opportunity to coach a national team. The demands of the job would conflict with other priorities in my life, such as wanting to spend more time at home. As everyone knows, if you get a job in the Indian team, you will not be available for IPL team. To be a capital administrator is a period of 10 months or month. He continues.

Ricky Ponting’s vast experience as a player and coach made him one of the candidates. In addition, the BCCI has approached several other high-profile names including Justin Langer (director of Lucknow Super Giants), Stephen Fleming (director of Chennai Super Kings), Gautam Gambhir (counselor of Kolkata Knight Riders) and Mahela Jayawardene ( management of the company). Mumbai Indians). of cricket). “Name of some names. Yesterday, we developed it, and we discussed Stephen Flaming and Gautam Gameri in recent days. However, based on what I said, I think it is unlikely that I will be a candidate for this job,” he added.

The deadline to apply for India’s chief executive post is May 27. Following a thorough review of the applications, the BCCI will invite the shortlisted candidates for an interview by the Cricket Advisory Committee. Which includes Sulakshana Naik, Ashok Malhotra, and Jatin Paranjape.
